reviews.text: This park has something for everyone. It's got open spaces for sports, its got a running track, it's got fields, it's got walking paths, it's got sculptures, fountains, trees, plazas, waffle trucks, grand architecture, and it's all situated between two metro stops. If you look out the window and the sun is shining, I highly recommend getting here as quickly as possible.
Very peaceful and beautiful park with astonishing architectures. Not as fancy as Grand Place, but also much much less commercial (not at all in fact). Worth visit and have a walk in a sunny day!

Big park. In a summer day lots of people.visit this park with friends and families. Outdoor area available for playing. It also holds some festivals and musical events occasionally. There is a restaurant with outdoor seating facility available. Also has some.moving food stalls and ice cream stalls. Looks awesome  all year around specially in autumn and spring.
Beautiful park in a central area. Really nice to walk around, close to several museums, restaurants and coffee shops. In the summer time a coffee shop is installed in the park.
It's a spacious parc, impressing building in the center, well maintained and clean. Would be even more beautiful with some nice flowers
Very impressive building. Fortunately I can't vouch for the quality of justice served here!
Sadly had scaffolding when we visited, slways our luck! Lovely building though.
Giant building. Impressive.
very historical place and plaza. you can see bruxells overall. please use elevator to climb up.
From the tourist's perspective this is an enourmous and really beautiful building. Good to see from distance and from street level.

The seat of the monarch of Belgium, the Royal Palace is a grand and imposing structure. There's a sprawling garden and a grand entrance to the palace. Entry is free but only for a few weeks a year. I've heard there's a unique ceiling made of Thai jewel beetles. For most tourists, it's just a nice pass by and a quick photo op.
Walked by this majestic palace. Great photo shot. not sure if you can go inside. Busy Saturday with many walkers about.

Some amazing architecture, both new looking and gothic. All buildings light up in the evening giving the atmosphere a completely different feeling. Only downside is a lot of people (unless you go early enough) and surrounding shops are pricey.

Some amazing architecture, both new looking and gothic. All buildings light up in the evening giving the atmosphere a completely different feeling. Only downside is a lot of people (unless you go early enough) and surrounding shops are pricey.

Cobblestones everywhere. As a person hailing from Mysore, India, this palace just did not appeal to me. I initially dismissed the place thinking it was just another government building until I was told otherwise that it was actually a frickin palace. Whoops, sorry for having high palatial expectations.

An interesting place to visit if you can't get around to visiting Europe. The landmarks are nearly exact to detail. There is a good vibe in the place and the attractions are interactive. There is a restaurant there too but I did not get it. To enter the park it is cheap compared to how long you'll be walking around.

I'd highly recommend it to people to visit as it's easy to access and you can get some nice photos of your experience.
It's cute. I mean a lot of people said to skip it. But I enjoy history and learning. So it was okay. Nothing special but a neat way to spend a few hours close to the other attractions.

A nice long, relaxing walk, even if you barely look at the monuments. A cool way to check the monuments out, learn about the countries, and view the different country attractions without any of the small problems that arise when you actually visit the monuments in real life, such as bad weather, etc. 
Combined ticket with atomium for 2 adults, 1 child, and 1 youth is just under €100. Kinda overpriced. Still good experience though.

It is a vey nice place to visit for children and adults. You can see most of Europe in a very beautiful way with 3D models that really reflect the original ones
They have nice cafeteria where you can eat, drink, and buy souvenirs

An interesting place to visit if you can't get around to visiting Europe. The landmarks are nearly exact to detail. There is a good vibe in the place and the attractions are interactive. There is a restaurant there too but I did not get it. To enter the park it is cheap compared to how long you'll be walking around.

I'd highly recommend it to people to visit as it's easy to access and you can get some nice photos of your experience.
Vicino al parlamento europeo. Poco visitata e conosciuta.

Gorgeous museum with a lot of history, both for the building, the collections and its surroundings.

 Some exhibitions are dated and in some places the museum needs a bit of TLC, but it doesn't make visiting it any less worthwhile.

 We visited purely for the temporary Inca Textile expo, which was gorgeous. All objects had been cleverly given a place and there were some interactive spaces for kods as well. In the permanent exhibitions, especially liked the medieval carpets (which Brussels used to be famous for) and the massive mosaic and columns in the Roman Hall.

The most unmotivated staff I have ever encountered in a museum in my life. Before I was able to buy a ticket the lady at the counter had to finish writing her text message. That said the building is impressive the collection is like in every other art and history Museum bit the Egypt bit of Roman bit of Japanese and Chinese bit of European art history. But worth a visit when in Brussels
Huge and nicely done. All about Middle ages, WW 1 and 2, aviation. Don't forget to check out the panorama!!!

Went there for a private party, had an exhibition running, but felt manipulated when said exhibition was only one room.

Building on itself is stylish and big, which makes it a pain when it comes to noise. Too much echo and whenever a group of people starts talking, it rapidly becomes unbearable to me.

Also, no handicap access has been seen when I went there. If there is one, I have not seen it.

The highlight of the museum's permanent collection is surely the exhibition on islamic art and culture. Well organized with additional material available in English and German. That can sadly not be said for the rest of the museum. It is probably not a usual custom to include an English descriptions in countries where there are two main languages. But it is counter-intuitive not to include an international description.
SO calm and peaceful with a fascinating architecture.. pure Chinese art that you can feel yourself in a small China
It hasn't opened up again but the gatdens are beautiful. Still "under construction". But the outside perimeter is worth a look, those are beautiful.
It'a a very beautiful to visit. However the interior is closed.
A must see ! Very unknown to the public since it's been closed for about a decade, but suggest a very nice frame in northern Brussels !
Beatififul Chinese buildings with plenty of amazing details, which are surrounded by nice park.

The best! One of the biggest and most impressive collection of dinosaurs. The children like it very much and can spend 2-3 hours without getting bored. There are a lot of interactive and educational activities. 
The human body exhibition is also very good and educational, with explicit images, videos and pieces. 
I strongly recommend it! 
And in the first Wednesday of each month there is a free entrance after 13:00.

A lovely museum if you like a good sack o' bones. The dinosaur fossils are great, and the T-Rex especially is great to look at. And if your eyes get sick of doing all the work, there are great audio logs of information that bring the exhibits to life even further. Not literally of course, that would be a lawsuit waiting to happen.
What a great museum, especially the dinosaurs section! Made me remember many things from my childhood and learn new ones too. Would recommend for young and old who want to spend a day inside.

Excellent museum of natural history. Human evolution well depicted with good information and model. Also the evolution of dinosaurs are depicted pretty well as well. Could have been better if species of bird models available. Often holds some special exhibition which are sometimes included in the tickets.

This is a place for real science enthusiasts. It houses a lot of rare specimens. The complex also contains several research departments ( molecular research among others). The place is very accesible. Definitely worth visiting!

Very impressive artifacts from Africa on display here. Very educative and the librarians just know their job. The tour guides also have historical background of each artifact on display. Worthwhile spending time here if you wanna know the history between Africa and Belgium.

I very much enjoyed this museum and found it worth the short day trip from Brussels. The museum is definitely more interactive and touched a lot upon African culture and ethnology rather than just being about colonial history.
Some people don't like how the museum takes a more a or less 'passive' view on what happened in the Congo but I personally did not mind. Good museum.

The museum is amazing! Exceptional collections and exhibition and the building itself is wonderful. 
Unique small negative point: the cafeteria, the waiter invited us not to stop there because he had too much work... but there were a lot of free tables...

grad museum with a modern and oldschool/historic architecture part! 

some more tribal figures and bronze would be great!
Newest museum in the Brussels area. Easy to reach with a car but also by public transport. Combine it with a walk through the park and you have a full day activity
If you love cinema and its history, this is the place to go. Highly recommended for cinephiles.
Nice, renovated place...let your artists soul comes out
The best place if you really love cinema !
Great movie selection, live piano with silent movies and they have also a nice interactive collections of antiques to see and play with.
Great service, great film, very cool museum

Undiscovered and underestimated by many tourists, but actually one of the best museum sites od Brussels. You can find out how courageous Belgian nation has been and that it doesn't forget tough moments or friends. Oh, and remember about the planes 😀

We have visited the garden before but this was a first time for the house.
Very surprised at how different and beautiful it was to other similar visits.
Definitely recommend this for a visit, food was good too.

It was a really interesting museum, I only wish the second floor had been open when we went. The aviation hall was very impressive as were the other collections. There are a lot of artifacts to see. They had everything from uniforms, to swords, to old toys. And don't forget to go up to the roof for a spectacular view of Brussels. 
My tips would be to keep your coat because both the aviation hall and the roof are pretty cold, and to go later when the renovations are finished on the second floor (although I am not sure how long that will be).

The WWI portion is newly remodeled and excellent with plenty of signs in English.  Part of the museum (WWII I believe) is closed for construction. The remainder of the museum has tons of stuff but barely anything in English

The museum is awesome, many history lessons, kids enjoyed the visiting, too. We were here in February 2019. A small inconvenient though - they were out of light on a small part of the museum and did not want to make a discount, but that was not such a bad issue.

Not a single famous or recognizable Magritte art work here. Very disappointing - especially when advertised as the worlds largest collection of Magritte. If you like to see his lesser known works, letters, home videos, and graphic design, they have those. The museum itself is a disappointment, terribly laid out, with millions of levels. At the entrance level they search bags and you must walk through a metal detector. Tickets are to be purchased on the -2 level. The Magritte exhibit starts on the third floor, but there’s a film is on the 1st, and there are no instructions or directions given on where to go. They also asked my backpack/ purse to be checked in a locker (free). 
The film was the most interesting part. It’s 10E for just the Magritte museum and 15E for the three museums combined, which is the ticket I bought. The three museums combined is a huge space with many steps and levels, and quite confusing.

Beautiful museum split over three floors starting from the basement. I’ve not really researched into Magritte’s work but leaving the museum I am now a fan! Recommend going early, and using the 2 for 1 offer and go to all museums in a day. €15! 
!!! Note that many of his key works are not actually in the exhibition!!! 
Real recommend the documentary at the end of the show as well. 
The shop also stocks interesting merchandise from cushion covers, notepads etc but the surly shop assistants look like they really don’t want to be there but don’t let that dampen your mood!

The museum's collection of Magritte's works and personal stuff is vast, and it takes about two hours to get through the building's three floors. There's this one issue, though, and it's that if you don't know any French or Dutch, you're kind of screwed, because there are barely any translations provided in English, which is a total bummer if you want to get a proper insight into the artist's mind. I'm not talking about letters and such, but basic things like writings on the walls or many pieces' names.

IT was a nice surprise to discover this museum. Very interesting works of this artist Magritte. Especially recommended for Dali's fans. There are 3 museum under One roof so be carefull buying tickets. Needed about 3--4hours for general not very deep but comfortable review

I love museums and this one is no exception. Magritte has been one of my favorite painters and many of his paintings can be seen here along with other lesser known(to me) painters but with equally interesting works of art.

Really nice and impressive museum to visit, kids had a lot of fun and enjoyed the day and each train. The only thing that could help to get a 5 star experience is if there was kind of a small bar or service for some light eat and drink, just enough to fill in parents with the extra energy to keep up with the siblings. For the rest, the excitement and joy is worth the price.

Was really a great time! I am not a train person but my husband loves them so I went along, and was pleasantly surprised! Lots of great information! Pretty interactive, and certainly engaging. Make sure you plan plenty of time! It is a very large museum.

Fun experience, good for kids with enough Lego stuff to keep them interested. It shows a good history of the Belgian railways as well as explaining some of the more technical aspects of trains in simple to understand ways. Particularly interesting for me was the trans Europe express carriage, which is a real front runner in opening up Europe for simple, less cost travel.
Great experience, really worth visiting! They really did a great effort making this a very fun and interesting visit. All the old train are meticulously restored. A nice visit for young and old!

Nice experience! I'd recommend the tour with audio guide, also bring your own headphones for extra comfort. 
Going through the whole place takes about 3 hours.
The canteen in DEVCO is not bed and the building is on a good location close to public transportation.
Nice and verry big billing...
Always fun to be there!
nice to be therea
Very impressive!!
Great to see the famous brewery and sample the beer where it's brewed. Staff passionate and very knowledgeable. Well worth fitting into a trip to Brussels.

Self-guided and guided tours available. Went on the Self-guided tour at €7. Interesting and a part of Brussels beer history. Two samplers at the end to round off a good spur of the moment decision to come here.

No beer trip to Brussels really begins until you make the pilgrimage to Cantillon. Wander through the brewery to see how the magic is made. Sit by the fire and sip a couple beers. Most of the beers that they pour here are only available here. Enjoy them while you can.

Got there at 16.26. What I heard? - We are closing - It is not 17.00... - Sorry, you can only buy some beer and drink it somewhere else.
If they can afford it in such location (scary and dirty, mostly migrants around) they must be cool

Always a treat to visit Cantillon.  If you've never been, I recommend the self-guided tour, which includes samples at the end.  You'll want to stick around and order more though!

As this beer is not distributed outside of Belgium, if one finds a bottle somewhere else, chances are it will be very pricy!  The brewery itself sells bottles at very reasonable prices.  We load up our suitcases to bring as many bottles home with us as possible (as Canadians not allowed to ship home).

The taproom has a relaxed atmosphere.  we've definitely hung out playing cribbage while sharing a few bottles with fellow tourists!

Definitely a must-see brewery for any beer-lover (or really, anyone--as this beer is unlike most beers out there today!)
A very interesting museum that tells you the recent history of Brussels via its transport network. It's very nice with kids too!
Great to see the old trams and a lovely park opposite

Great place for tram fans or not :)
The oldest tram in original condition can be seen. 
Also the newest metro has a short version and you can see how will look. 
Can take some old trams to go to the city.
You need at least 3 hours for this visit.
You can see old technik and after take a ride with old tram. Good place to visit.

A superb find which wasn't in my tourist guide. Open Sundays and Wednesdays during the summer. Sunday is the time to go as it is possible to catch a vintage tram from the city centre. There is a combined museum ticket which allows a visit to the museum and multiple trips on the trams, which cover several routes. For once, as a tourist in Belgium, I felt I'd had my money's worth!
Parking is hard to find and all the time controlled.. Be careful
Nice Audi plant. All people I have been in contact with have been very friendly.

They're among leaders in car manufacturing.. so what will we expect from them.. one of the best maintained premises, neatness, places in order and the pride of their product. They have all of it.. it's Audi. I've not visited Ingolstadt but I've heard from my colleagues that it's unbeatable in quality.. In Brussels also they're working with spatter free theme. So no need to wear glasses in the plant... In coming future they will give feeling of Nasa visit 😊
Tolle preformence
Good factory
If you love cinema and its history, this is the place to go. Highly recommended for cinephiles.
Nice, renovated place...let your artists soul comes out
The best place if you really love cinema !
Great movie selection, live piano with silent movies and they have also a nice interactive collections of antiques to see and play with.
Great service, great film, very cool museum
Great frites. Good selection of sauces. But quite a long wait times. This place was recommended to me by a local.
Overhyped by our tour guide. Fries are average, sandwiches are not great at all.
We were not impressed. Bought into the hype from our tour guide. Pretty average fries.
I have been there after our tour guide recommended it. It is a nice place for a quick pick up.
Great place to get an esay& fast friture!!

Average fries, not sure what everyone is raving about. Had better fries (and homemade mayo) from the Potato Bar in Bruges. These ones tasted old and oily to me. The place is a hole in the wall. Friendly guy, though, and at least they have a cash/coin machine to pay with, so they’re not handling the coins and the food.

Yum yum yum! It might be the best french fries I've ever eaten - better than "meniken pis" by far! Prices are reasonable and affordable, nothing fancy or complicated but still tasty and highly recommend place to eat french served hot and mind-blowing Delicious! If you in the city you have to try it out- you won't be disappointed!

Good fries, quick service.  The staff don't handle cash. There is a machine that tells you the total then you insert the money.  It give change back. Cards are accepted,  but again, the staff never touch them.  There is barely room for 5 people inside.  This is a to-go place only.
Small fry shop in a fairly central location. There's not much room inside but there are a few tables with umbrellas outside. Seems to be cheaper than surrounding fry shops.
Delicious fries with Andalouse sauce and a very helpful couple running the shop. Will return here again when I am next in the city centre.
Nice pizza! Easy and tasty no fuss but consistent quality. Great for lunch or after a long drinking session!😁
Not the best pizza in town, but good for a quick lunch.
It's ok, not great. Toppings are interesting but light dosing.

We went around 12:00 noon on a Friday and were the only people in the restaurant. At about 1:00 the place was FULL! The pizza was delicious, not too heavy and the toppings were fresh. We ordered the slice with potato, cheese and truffle sauce recommended by a friend who lives in brussels. It was delicious! A slightly different flavor than traditional pizza but the addition of the truffle gave it a very distinct taste. I would absolutely order it again. If you don't like truffle they have many other flavors as well with meats, vegetables, red sauces and mozzarella cheese. The lunch menu was 2 sizable slices and a beverage (your choice of bottled beverage) for 9€. Thank you Mama Roma, we loved your pizza!
Friendly staff. Good service.
Nice service and attention, I really like the steak meat and the fries.
Plus que déplorable! J'ai commandé et je n'ai jamais reçu ma commande! Je ne recommande pas du tout!

Nous avions conmander hier à 19h30 via take away, livraison j'aimais arriver, même en allant sur place le personnel n'a pas trouvé de solution au problème que du contraire aucun remboursement n'a été fait, le numéros de téléphone n'appartient même pas au restaurant mes au soi-disant petit frère qui n'a jamais répondu, la carte du restaurant ne reflète pas la réalité et l'hygiène. Je ne crois même pas qu' ils savent la traduction de ce mot, j'appelle ça une belle grosse escroquerie.
J'y reviendrai
Très bon sandwich bonne pizza et pâte les patrons sont gentil

Amazing place, great food, drinks, desserts and of course wines. Certainly one must go to this place if they fancy a nice french cuisine in the city of Bruxelles. However, keep in mind the great authentic food doesn't come cheap an certainly has priced higher than average places. Definitely recommend to everyone to go and enjoy the authenticity of this place along with the food and drinks. Another recommendation is to make a reservation as early as possible as this place could make you wait for you and your loved ones to be seated and enjoy the great meal.
We had a lovely dinner here on Christmas eve. The food was wonderful. The place was elegant. Most of the staff were amazing. Some were a little off. For that price you except a bit warmer reception.

I loved this place a lot and I wasn't the only one. Make sure to book a table in advance for both lunch and dinner, or be prepared to be asked to come back half an hour later. Awesome kitchen that is sort of open, we had mussels which were delicious. We had to wait a long time for the mayo though our fries were cold when it arrived. The Belgian wine was nice. Great lunch.

Very good place to eat! Very nice inside. 
When in without a reservation managed to get a table. 
Food was very good! Mussels and steak very good
Service was good and helped with English!

Poor service in what appears to be a historically decorated restaurant. We went as a group of two. We only wanted one main course, plus some drinks, appetizers and desserts. We were told that because we were two people, we must order two main courses, despite that we said we only wanted one main along with several other smaller dishes. Further, we had to wait for 10 minutes before we were offered a menu and then 15 more minutes before anyone came to take our order - only telling us that we could not order what we wanted. We left. Walked straight to La Kasbah for great service and delicious food.

The food was very good, but service was very rude. They refused to serve starters and wine before everyone from our table arrived. Also they refused to serve dessert to someone that didn't had main course, he arrived only after we had dinner. The waiter was making rude comments and made us feel not welcome in the restaurant. Not going back despite good food.
Mussels and fries were okay, but not exceptional. Service could be improved. Overall not a bad place, but a bit pricey.
Terrible experience. Most overpriced restaurant I’ve ever been to. Service was beyond bad and rude. Anyone telling you otherwise on these reviews works here. Please avoid.
A very nice bistro with good service.
Traditional restaurant in cental Brussels.  Moules mariniere + fries was excellent.  Creme brulee was tasty but huge!
Una maravilla de tienda y maravillosas las dependientas.PRECIOSA tienda  Y FANTASTICAS DEPENDIENTAS.

Pleasant restaurant in the Ixelles area, close to the birthplace of Audrey Hepburn (!) The beer on the tap menu is not very comprehensive (only 4), but there are numerous Belgian beers in bottle form. A plus for all the great posters decorating the walls! The food is well done, with a focus on the local cuisine. Beyond the moules, the rabbit in cherry beer sauce is a must, together with cooked potatoes. There are vegetarian options as well.

Food is ok, the menu does provide a lots of choices and the results in the plates are correct. The service is nice and relatively smooth with 3 young ladies running the restaurant back and forth! Not the best brasserie in Brussels

Nice place, good service and (Belgian) food, small choice of beers except in bottles, but in general not as fantastic as expected. i guess the timing, if it’s full or not, etc should have big impacts on your final feelings
Hearty meals with fairly reasonable prices. Helpful and friendly  staff too. Interior is cool, not too fancy, but maybe a bit alternative. Would recommend and visit again!
Very nice place... took the lunch.. what a quick and good service!
Great location and facilities... Single bedroom apartment with full kitchen and laundry. Great
Awesome, one of the best places. Be careful with limited warm water.
Impossible d'obtenir une facture malgré de multiples relances par mail et téléphone, manque de professionnalisme... Incroyable !
El ultimo piso hermoso
Best vietnaminiem place to eat in town. Pho it's amazing and the starters. You will not regret this place 4 sure..
Excellent food, not a fancy place but really good authentic Vietnamese food and very friendly staff. Place is nice and cosy too.
Quite old and not fency restaurant. But have the best phở in town. Authentic with southern flavor.

I really like this very small Viet restaurant, you can easily pass it but if you go in, you won't regret it.

The service is quicker in the afternoon, so if you go later the waiting time gets longer.

I always go for the bo bun as it's super tasty : you have a good serving of meat and nems. It's very simple food when you think about it but it definitely does it's job if you're looking for tasty food at a good price.

The way of cooking can differ a bit depending when you go, sometimes they are bit more generous, or the nems are a bit burned, but it's still quite good.

The fried prawns are also good, so it's not all batter, it actually has a full prown,just wished they gave more than 5 or at least serve an equal number.

You can pay by card, there is a bathroom available and there is free wifi inside. This place is quite cosy but it has everything you need for a smalk breal and have nice food!
Delicious food and lovely people at Than Binh! If you go for lunch you can get a 2 course meal for €9.50, would definitely recommend this little restaurant

Chez Jacques cares about your experience. They're friendly and make accurate suggestions on which wine to get, depending on what dish you're getting. Never a disappointing night with Jean-Philippe, a great, graceful and generous host. If you don't speak French, their team will help you out in whatever language they can.
In short: good people, good food and even better drinks. You won't be disappointed!
The food was excellent and beer too! Nice place with god service. The only con was the time we spent there waiting for food and drinks but to be honest the place was packed...

I've now eaten at Chez Jaques two or three times, and each time I'm incredibly satisfied with what is served up. The dishes are classic for the area: fish, seafood, and meat, but the ambience touches something that can only be found in Brussels. Whether you choose the fixed menus, or à la carte, the value is great, and the food delicious.

Adrien, the chef is often seen mingling with the guests, and the whole place has a family run vibe to it. Great for tourists and locals alike, Chez Jacques is always worth a visit in the St. Catherine neighborhood.
Typical Belgian Bistro with a nice "neighbourhood restaurant" atmosphere. Food is ok but not exceptional. A little bit pricy for what we had
The food was really nice, the price is fair

Excellent - good simple French/Belgian brasserie classics done very well. The sole meuniere was rated by my wife as probably the best she'd ever had and the garlic mushrooms on toast were as good as any I'd had. Well priced wine list and a complimentary liqueur with the coffee - and all for less than €100 per couple. Better than the more expensive 'fancy' restaurant in our nearby hotel where we'd eaten the previous evening. Highly recommended.
Brasserie with a good location and good value for money.  The food is what you can expect from a brasserie: simple, but tasty (good fries). Pleasant atmosphere.
Awsome food, super friendly staff. I todally recomend it.
Nothing special... Food was ok and staff was friendly but didnt speak english which made things lil bit confusing...
Top service and good food!!

Love this place. Beautiful inside and had a view of the kitchen .We chose the yeux fermés menu, so we didn't know what we would get. 4 courses was the perfect amount and the food was amazing. Would recommend!
Nice experience, even if i would have preferred to choose myself the 5 dish menu

The cuisine is a fusion between French and Japanese. We took the 30 euro menu (entry, main dish and desert). Can't comment on the little quantity, because maybe people go there for a reason. The food tasted very good and the combinations were original. The two points less are for the bread. We were 8 people amd the waiter brought us 6 slices of bread. Really. 6. Either he couldn't count, either he thought only 6/8 people need to eat bread in that restaurant. When he brought the main dish, we asked for more bread. He didnt bring bread until we asked a second time and people were already done eating their dish. Guess what. 6 slices of bread. Again. So that's no mistake. Again two people couldnt eat their slice of bread. Really guys? There were only 2 tables in the entire restaurant at lunch. Bitter experience to be honest. But food is ok. So if you feel like being more assertive to the staff, go to try the food.
Charming service, and excellent food.
Excellent ! Love the concept and the food is really good, a little pricey though. Service is great ! Would recommend.
Skilful cooking in a classical style. Wonderful waiting staff who know just how much attention is needed. Well worth a visit for an memorable meal.
Fish lovers visiting Brussels should make certainly a stop at this stylish and outstanding fish restaurant.  Staff is nice, service is excellent and the dishes are of top quality !
good food but a bit pricy and very slow service.

Super place. Historic old restaurant with beautiful internal panelling and stained glass. The food is excellent. Amazing fish and superb game when in season. The sole and plaice are excellent with fish soup and croquettes deliciously put together. Very well worth making a visit.

On the place Sainte-Catherine, you can find a charming restaurant that also happens to be on the Michelin Guide. Since 1974, it has been serving its delicious meals. We were dressed very casually and sheepishly stood at the door of this elegant eatery with its fine dining napkins, table cloths, and utensils. However, we were welcomed in and treated with the utmost respect. I adored the ambiance. At tables beside us, there were men and women that had lived long lives. They were dressed well and it seemed as though they just needed to come in, call the waiter by name, and say that they wanted the usual. They started us off with tiny shrimp that you had to peel with your fingers in a specific way; the waiter demonstrated it for us first. That was an interesting experience. Then came the dishes we had ordered; I really loved the lobster fricassee which was a specialty of theirs. I regret that I did not try any of their desserts.

What a wonderful restaurant!

Truly Amazing Thai food!

Must try the stir fried mix vegetables!

The ambiance was wow!

Truly a star restaurant!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

A surprisingly refreshing and modern Thai restaurant in the heart of Brussels, that offers French twist on fine Asian cuisine and also great cocktails. Serene and soothing ambience. The choice of meals is large and each plate comes with refined presentation. I recommend the grilled giant prawns, which were very tender and served with delicious tamarin sauce. From the main courses my selection fell on the sea-bream grilled in banana leaf, topped up with hot chilli sauce. The desserts stood with suggestions such as parfait nougat and homemade sorbet de mangue. Very warm and amicable service. The crowd is casually dressed and from all ages. Prices  - reasonable.
Very authentic Thai, good taste and full recipe. Staff is friendly and relax atmosphere
Best Tom Yum Goong soup I have had outside of Thailand. Simply amazing 👍😋
Very nice food. Not very spicy.

Love the place, love the vibe.
Everything is freshly made, tasty and healthy. I recommend you skip the desert as they are not that good nor healthy.
My favorite vegetarian in Brussels ! Diverse and tasty buffer, cold and warm. Delicious dessert. Cosy seating. Friendly service. Good value. I love it.
We love this place. Great good great service. Just great
Amazing vegetarian restaurant! Food was super tasty and the staff really nice!

Vegetarian restaurant of first quality and first class. Extremely kind people. Very fresh food in large variety and very tasty!
Even a carnivore would skip his filet contemplating these plates!...
